attributes.action: Decriminalise the consumption of cannabis, and consider other drugs too.
attributes.additional_details:
See the case study of Portugal, who already decriminalised drugs a long time ago for, the long term effects:

http://mic.com/articles/110344/14-years-after-portugal-decriminalized-all-drugs-here-s-what-s-happening#.CBXLREabf

Cannabis has already been decriminalised in Derbyshire, Dorset and Surrey – this should extend throughout the nation, if not with other drugs too. The expenditure on prosecution of personal drug use should be allocated elsewhere (i.e. NHS or education) - it is very wasteful
attributes.background: The War on Drugs has failed, ruining people's lives by giving them criminal records for harmless personal consumption; people deserve opportunities for rehabilitation instead of punishment. Prisons face problems of overpopulation and decriminalising personal use of drugs will save time and money

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/114683

If you would like the Government to legalise a different drug than cannabis for personal use, you could start a petition about that.
